title.narrative: Western Balkans Readmission Capacity Building Facility (WBCAP), engagement

description.narrative: The overall objective of the intervention is to contribute to enhanced national migration management and readmission systems in the Western Balkans, and strengthened cooperation with relevant countries of origin and EU Member States on readmission, through the establishment of a Western Balkans Readmission Capacity-Building Facility (WBCAP).

sector.narrative: Facilitation of orderly, safe, regular and responsible migration and mobility

description.narrative: FL §06.32.10.13 Migration and repatriation

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 3. Improved gender- and protection-sensitive practices on return and readmission of WB and third country nationals in the WB

description.narrative: % of WB authorities using gender- and protection-sensitive operational guidelines or SoPs.

title.narrative: 2. Improved functional communication, negotiations and cooperation channels on readmission between WB and priority CoOs

description.narrative:
1. Number of WB beneficiaries reporting improved communication and cooperation channels with at least one priority CoO.
2. Number of newly developed readmission mechanisms between WB and CoOs that are developed

description.narrative:

title.narrative: WB and CoOs have established operational readmission cooperation and negotiation channels

description.narrative:
1. Number of assessments carried out on the state of readmission cooperation frameworks between WB and CoOs
2. Number of multilateral and bilateral meetings organized between WB and CoOs to facilitate the establishment of channels on readmission

title.narrative: The needs and interests of participating WB beneficiaries on migration management and readmission are collected and considered for future financial support through the WBCAP Facility.

description.narrative:
1. Number of assessments completed to identify priority projects
2. Number of proposals developed and approved through the WBCAP Facility

title.narrative: 1. Successful implementation by WB authorities of the readmission actions funded by the WBCAP Facility, as adapted to their needs and in line with international and European migrant protection standards.

description.narrative:
1. Number of complementary activities on migration management and readmission identified to be carried out under the WBCAP Facility with the financial support of the donor (disaggregated by site, and activity type/area)
2. % of recommendations from the Functional Analysis on Readmission Frameworks and Capacities in the WB addressed by the complementary support actions

title.narrative: Electronic readmission case management systems are established between EU Member States and Western Balkan authorities

description.narrative:
1. Number of digital maturity assessments conducted
2. Number of electronic case management systems established
3. Number of training sessions on the use and management of the RCMS organized
4. Number of regional and bi-lateral meetings organized
5. Number of EU Readmission Agreements Implementation Protocols Revised

title.narrative: Electronic readmission case management systems are established between EU Member States and Western Balkan authorities

description.narrative:
1. Number of digital maturity assessments conducted
2. Number of electronic case management systems established
3. Number of training sessions on the use and management of the RCMS organized
4. Number of regional and bi-lateral meetings organized
5. Number of EU Readmission Agreements Implementation Protocols Revised

title.narrative: Readmission officers across WB have the skills and knowledge to conduct effective, gender- and protection-sensitive and rights-oriented return within the region

description.narrative:
1. Number of joint regional training sessions for migration and readmission officials
2. % of trainees who have an increased knowledge after the training
3. Number of return and readmission case management training curricula adapted to the beneficiary context
4. Existence of a regional group of readmission specialists in the WB

title.narrative: Gender- and protection-sensitive operational guidelines or SOPs on readmission are available across the WB.

description.narrative:
1. Number of national follow-up analyses drafted
2. Number of regional meetings organized on readmission in the Western Balkans
3. Number of bi-lateral meetings organized on specific challenges and good practices.
4. Number of guidelines or SOPs on readmission developed

title.narrative: WB and CoOs develop better understanding of readmission procedures and challenges, and establish readmission mechanisms (arrangements or agreements)

description.narrative:

2. Number of technical workshops on developing readmission agreement/arrangement
3. Number of working study visits organized and undertaken during the project
